result.execSummary:
The defendant Elizabeth L Hatton was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Strangulation and Suffocation [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse, Repeater], a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.235(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
STAYED.
Consecutive to: to any current sentence

miscConds.notes:
Court costs and DNA surcharge to be paid as a Condition of Probation.

If probation is revoked and a prison term is not ordered, or if probation is discharged/terminated, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collection may include income assignment.

Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided,   immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.
Maintain absolute sobriety.
Submit to random urine screens.
Not to use or possess of alcohol/drug paraphernalia/drugs without a valid prescription.
Valid prescriptions to be taken in the manner they were prescribed.
Domestic violence counseling to be determined by Agent.
No violent contact with victim or any member of the household.

timeConds.notes: Condition Time - nonworking hours. All 60 days STAYED and Defendant to be release to Day Report Center for compliance for 90 days.

records.addlTxt: Notice of Case Status Change - Revoked - Sentenced to Prison
Amended
dated August 20, 2015 from WCS, Elizabeth Hatton successfully completed DRC program (reviewed by Judge Ramirez on 08-25-15)
with Elements of criminal offenses to which plea is being entered.

Defendant Elizabeth L Hatton in court, in custody, with attorney Ronald James Sonderhouse.   Ted S. Szczupakiewicz appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant enters a plea of no contest to Count 1,  Court finds defendant guilty.  Counts 2 and 3 dismissed and read in.

Court orders the following:
- Total sentence: 3 years (Initial Confinement: 1 year 6 months, Extended Supervision: 1 year 6 months)CONSECUTIVE to any current sentence. STAYED
- 3 years Probation. 
- Court costs of $368.00 to be paid as a Condition of Probation
- DNA Surcharge of $250.00 to be paid as a Condition of Probation
- Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided, immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.
- Conditions of Probation:  Maintain absolute sobriety/Random UAs.  No use or possession of alcohol/drug paraphernalia/drugs without a valid prescription.  Valid prescriptions to be taken in the manner they were prescribed.  Continue with Mental Health care.  DV Counseling to be determined by Agent.  No violent contact with victim or any member of the household.

CONDITION TIME: 60 days - NON WORKING HOURS WITH STANDARD RELEASE CONDITIONS - All 60 days STAYED and defendant to be released to Day Report Center for compliance for 90 days.
Hearing on April 30, 2015 at 10:00 am.
